title: Newspaper report from voter poll interval

content.prompt: A newspaper poll found that 52 percent of the respondents in a large random sample of likely voters in a district intend to vote for candidate Smith rather than the opponent. A 95 percent confidence interval for the population proportion was computed to be 0.52 Â± 0.04. Based on the confidence interval, which of the following should the newspaper report to its readers?

choices.label: Smith will win because a majority of voters are in favor of Smith.
There is a 95% chance that Smith will win.
The poll predicts Smith will win, but there is a 5% chance that the prediction is incorrect due to sampling error.
With 95% confidence, there is convincing evidence that Smith will win.
No prediction about who will win can be made with 95% confidence.
